headline: The Best Fresh Tomato Salsa
description: This fresh tomato salsa is made with chopped tomatoes, onion, bell peppers, and cilantro mixed with lime juice and cumin for a quick and simple salsa.

video.description: See how to make a simple fresh salsa from scratch.
video.name: The Best Fresh Tomato Salsa

name: The Best Fresh Tomato Salsa
recipeIngredient: 4 teaspoons chopped fresh jalapeno pepper (including seeds)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together tomatoes, onion, green bell pepper, cilantro, lime juice, jalapeno pepper, cumin, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

review.reviewBody: Excellent flavor and I added garlic. Everyone loved it!
I add garlic but otherwise I make this as directed and no one ever complains. Love it!
I used the last cherry tomato and jalapeno harvest from my garden. I think the flavor is just perfect - not too hot but it's got a bite.

Didn't have cumin and don't like cilantro, so left those out. Add about tsp sugar and most of small habenaro pepper with some of the seeds. Used some sungold tomatoes. 1 garlic, chopped. Cut all with knife rather than vitamix to keep it chunky. Great flavor, but spicy hot, the way we like it.

So for anyone that is accustomed to store-bought jar salsa only, it’s good for you to know that the salsa will not taste like that. This is a fresh authentic type salsa similar to what you would eat in Mexico… Which is much different than what you will taste out of the jar from the store. This may taste a little underwhelming to some for that reason. That said, this was delicious and will become my go to salsa recipe. I love Mexican food! The green pepper was a surprise and I suspect really adds to the flavour. I chopped it super small as not everyone in my house is keen on green pepper, and I think this allowed for it to subtly shine. Only subs I made was some cayenne instead of jalepeno for a bit of heat as I didn’t have any jalepenos on hand. I put only a pinch. Thanks for the recipe!
This salsa was delicious.
Boring recipe - very little flavor.

Made this exactly as is with one addition... I added 2 cloves of garlic. I used a garlic press, so it wasn’t a lot of garlic. Also used the “Vidalia onion chopper” with smallest dice insert to chop all vegetables except Jalepeno. Got rave reviews from all guests.
Delicious! My picky family loved it. I used dried cilantro leaves and cayenne pepper as substitutes.

Followed recipe exactly except added a little more cilantro. Usually tweak recipes after trying, but this is right on as is. Heat can be adjusted for those who prefer a milder taste, and salt could be added for some. Very fresh tasting, and even with all the chopping, easy. Maybe next time I will do as others did and use food processer.

Absolutely WONDERFUL! I didn't have any green peppers, so I went to the garden and picked a yellow pepper. Also, I only planted Roma tomatoes this year. I wanted to make a "test" batch first, before I do my canning. This is the recipe I'm going to use when I'm ready to can. Thank you!

My family really loved it. I'm not the spicey sort so I only put 1/2 the jalapenos. I also peeled my tomatoes first. The ones I planted this year had a tougher skin. A definite keeper for me. Thank you for sharing!

Very easy and much better than the store bought stuff. I had to get rid of sone of the bounty from the summer garden and this was the perfect way. I used 2 smaller jalapeños with seeds and 1 small cayenne (seeded) for the kick my kids like. Excellent.
I made this exactly by the recipe and it is delicious! The longer it sits the better it gets! I shared some with our neighbor and she said it was the best salsa she’d ever eaten!
Absolutely easy to make and tastes amazing. Will definitely make again
I did not have bell pepper. So we just left that out. Can get a little spicy depending if you leave jalapeño seeds or not. Super easy to make though!!

Very basic pico recipe.
You can use lemon juice if you don't have lime. 
I added v8 and tomato sauce to make it actual salsa.
A total crowd pleaser! Love this salsa.

Definitely the tomato salsa I was looking for. It is very simple and definitely delicious. I did add salt, pepper and cumin powder to taste and deviated from the recipe, the rest is as is. This is perfect if you have way too much tomatoes lying around!

Fresh, Fresh, Fresh. This salsa is so fresh and flavorful. The ingredient measurements are spot on allowing a balance of flavor in each bite. The aroma is intoxicating too. It has a nice blend of seasonings that don't overpower the elements. My family consumed the entire batch with dinner.

This is my favorite salsa recipe for garden fresh tomatoes. I'd rather chop it all by hand for a homemade look as well as taste. I add a clove of minced garlic. I like that you can control the heat by how much jalapeño you use. Also by how many seeds you add, or you can decide not to add seeds at all, since they hold most of the heat. My friends love it and request it when they know the tomatoes are coming in. I serve it with the "dippers" style tortilla chips so you get all the good stuff.
Excellent tasty fresh salsa. Didn’t need to change a thing!
Awesome recipe with great flavor!
A bit bitter for us, will probably add a sweetener next time. Ended up adding a bit more jalapeno, 7 rings of ours.
This is my new go-to salsa recipe. Easy to make and tastes so fresh. I will have to double it next time because it goes so fast!
This is my new go-to salsa recipe. Easy to make and tastes so fresh. I will have to double it next time because it goes so fast!
Our favorite fresh salsa! Substituting red pepper flakes for jalapenos works too. I also added a very small amount of fresh cilantro plus 3 cloves of minced garlic.

It was flavorful and as was mentioned, increases as it rests. I only half the amount of roma tomatoes called for so I used cherry tomatoes for the rest... Taking care to let about 2/3 of seeds fall to side. I added a little crossed garlic and tell tomatillos too! Will make again!

Only changes I made was I used mostly yellow Bell, & a piece of green. 1/2 Red, 1/2 White onion, Squeezed half a lime, and Added a piece of a hot banana pepper.. with everything else in the recipe, Threw it in a blender, (Careful not to liquify! lol)... and this flavor is On Point!
Really good salsa. I like the hot stuff and thought this recipe as is was a little tame, so I kicked it up a notch by adding another jalapeno. Really good heat and taste. Easy to make.
I reduced jalapeno to 2 tsp (personal preference) and added chopped garlic. I will definitely make again and again! Thanks for a great recipe!!
I would decrease the amount of onion. Otherwise, this is terrific and I will use every summer when I have a surplus of tomatoes. The extra is in my freezer.
Excellent salsa! 1/2 the jalepano as we arent loving too much spice. My picky grandson told me Best Salsa Ever - all I needed....
Great recipe. I used half the onion and one jalapeño (personal preference), and added minced garlic.
Great way to use up fresh tomatoes and peppers from the garden. I leave out the seeds when putting in the hot pepper.
I make this every year. People even request it now. I follow the recipe, adding hot peppers as requested. Works best with Scoops chips, to get as much as you can in each bite!
Great for a salsa base!!! I did use fresh garlic since our family loves garlic. Make sure you drain your tomatoes, if you are not using Romas. Tasted like our garden!!!

I used double the lime juice and half the cilantro the second time around to adjust to our tastes, but this was super easy to make and turned out great! There aren't many better ways to use up the loads of tomatoes we get from the garden in August!
Well this is very easy and I did what one reviewer suggested threw it all in a food processor! VIOLA
Subbed Parsley for cilantro
Garden season! Fabulously ripe ‘maters. Roasted my jalapeños, Hungarian sweets and hots. The cumin makes it, but this is a strong flavor. Work yourself up to your desired amount.
Only change I made was adding garlic and four seeded jalapeños. I doubled it and it didn’t last long. This recipe is a keeper!
I will add the cilantro next time!!!
Added extra tomatoes since my jalapeño was hot!

This salsa is DELICIOUS! I added 2 whole jalapeños, 4 garlic cloves, the juice of a whole lime and some more salt, then blended it up in my Ninja Bullet. It is so flavorful and fresh. I will definitely be making this again!
So fresh and perfect flavors. Family loved it

Very light and fresh! Wonderful with chips. We also loved it on grilled chicken.
Followed the recipe without changes
This was quick, simple and delicious! Great way to use my sudden plethora of ripe tomatoes, peppers and onions!
Added other fresh herbs - parsley.
Easy to make. Cilantro was a bit overpowering. Waiting to see if resting in the fridge balances out the flavors more, but it is a good recipe.
I love fresh salsa. It’s so good. I do use pickled jalapeño peppers and dried cilantro and bottled lime juice. So it’s not totally fresh but is still very delicious.
I made this with a few changes and people beg me for my recipe! I add 2 tablespoons of white vinegar and two cloves of garlic.
Only added one minced garlic. I concur it is Best Fresh Tomato Salsa!
Best homemade salsa there is, just follow the recipe! Perfect....my family loves it! No more store bought salsa for us!!
My tomato to sweet onion ratio is 2:1 & for this recipe's quantity I add 1/2 tblspn of olive oil. Helps the flavors mingle!
Very fresh! I used 1.5 times the spices because it was a little bland. I also ran it through the blender so it was only slightly chunky and each bite includes all the flavors.

I made it. But confused. I dont remember ever eating salsa with raw onions. They're always cooked. Are you supposed to cook this mixture? [Addendum:] Put everything in the food processor, the taste is out of this world perfect! Just add diced tomatoes to the puree and it's ready to serve and impress.

I rated this 5 stars but it was absolutely the wrong recipe for salsa. I tried to make it better by adding garlic and some chili powder but I think I may of just ruined it. The recipe I liked started with only using three tomatoes not 3 cups of tomatoes chopped. I either rated the wrong recipe or the lady switched her ingredients around. This salsa was not good and there was too much of something and not enough of something else. It was missing something big time.
Yummy. This salsa has a very nice kick.
I did not have jalapeno pepper in the house but made it anyway. Delicious!
I added 1 Tbsp chopped garlic from the jar, 1/4-1/2 tsp chili powder and used the "fresh" cilantro in the tube from the grocery store approximately 1 Tbsp or use to your taste.

Most definitely will make again. Made as directed. Very yummy! Nice spiciness...and we like spicy. Of course, it's going to depend upon the jalapeno. Used fresh picked tomatoes, peeled (cut x in bottom, 30 sec in boiling water then immediately dunk in ice water) and squeezed out seeds. Think next time will be a little more aggressive in squeezing out seeds/liquid. Froze some to see how it does with that.

I made this recipe with home grown tomatoes. I followed the recipe, except I tripled it! It made 5 quart jars. The first day 2 jars were already gone!! It was super easy, refreshing, delicious and a hit with the family. 
I’ll make this again and again!!
I've been making this salsa with my garden tomatoes, peppers, and cilantro for 3 years. Everyone loves it especially the kids!
I took the seed s out of the jalapeño only because the person getting it couldn’t have the heat. Otherwise I made the recipe the same it was yummy.
Great salsa - was pretty watery at first but I think that was because of the tomatoes I used. I think in the future I will salt and drain the tomatoes.
This is a medium-hot recipe. Very tasty.
Red onion and add garlic....Great recipe

Added some smoked paprika.
Used green onions instead of reg onions
I used hatch peppers instead of green peppers. I added extra jalapeños. Everyone loved it.
No changes,I will definitely make it again.
Great recipe. I added more jalapeños and about a tablespoon of sugar to make it more spicy yet sweet.
one jalapeno was enough for me! I liked it without cumin :) will make again!
I used two jalapeños and was happy with the recipe. Easy to make.

I loved it and considered giving it a 5! Mrs. Micamus thought it was too hot. The jalapeños from our garden this year are hotter than normal. 

I will be making it again!
Excellent!!

I love that I had almost all the ingredients I needed, in the garden. The only thing I changed, well not really changed but added, was a tiny bit of garlic because I'm a garlic freak lol. such a fresh, easy and delicious salsa!
Tastes so fresh! I puréed part of it for a saucy salsa, and left part of it unblended for pick de gallo.

I basically followed the recipe as is, but I put the vegetables on the grill first and gave them a little grilling first, to get some smoke flavor into my salsa (and burn off a little water so it's less juicy) and it worked gangbusters.
Simple & delicious. Nice thing is you can increase or decrease ingredients to taste. I used yellow pepper because i like the colour.
Whole family loved it!!!
Excellent!
I'll defently make it again.
Have made several times according to the recipe, for a low sodium, fresh tasting salsa. Thanks for sharing

I made the salsa and it is GREAT! just really wish I knew what the serving size is. Using the salsa in my meal preps and am calculating my nutrition. Could really use the help. Thanks for the recipe share, really fresh and tasty!
left out salt

I doubled the salt, pepper, and cumin for more flavor. I also added a few cloves of garlic. Instead of a green pepper, I used a poblano. And instead of jalapeno, I used serrano for more spice. I’ll probably add another serrano or two after I enjoy some more of this, to finish it off with some serious heat!
Simple, but good adjust heat to your own taste
Awesome!

was excellent without green bell pepper and cilantro. For those people who said it was bland, you just need to make sure you use fresh cumin and add a bit more salt and pepper to up the flavor and then it's amazing!
My wife and I have been making this frequently for years now. We love it except we add garlic and do not add cumin, but that is just our flavor preference.
Loved loved loved
Very fresh and light tasting!
This recipe is great! I left out the bell pepper, only because I'm not a fan of them in salsa. Other than that, I followed the recipe and it was a hit.
I added a half granny's Smith apple and some garlic. The apple masked the heat and I'm just a freak for garlic. Wonderful easy and can be served as is or thrown in a food processor easy enough.
Followed the recipe exactly and had it chill in the fridge overnight and tried it the next day and couldn't eat it. Used fresh tomatoes from my garden too, what a waste.
Gooddd and quick.. no peppers so add a little cayenne.. perfect
I added 1 cup chopped onion and I used tabasco and habenero peppers instead of jalapenos.

I put this in my food processor and mixed it all up and kept adding what flavors I liked the most of all of this. I didn't have any jalapeno's so I added a tiny dab of ghost pepper sauce. Tiny because you can always add more and it's strong. I don't think I added all the onion but it was fine and I love onion. My friends and boyfriend loved it. So healthy.
